title: Type ID Cold Case Files: April 2009
content:
Type ID Cold Case Files: April 2009

OK Folks, by now you know the drill. These are all zero-response type ID requests from April 2009. If you can resolve one, post your answer on the respective thread and let us know back here so we can track the results.

Can you get these? We'll (re)start the clock at the date/time of this posting.

Ready.. Set.. Go!

// SANS

[city guilds - sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122054/http:/typophile.com/node/56581)  
 [Ignore most of what you see but tell me what you see](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122054/http:/typophile.com/node/56608)  
 [Another grotesque - New Wave Films](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122054/http:/typophile.com/node/56723)  
 [help identifying font?](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122054/http:/typophile.com/node/56761)  
 [PLEASE TELL ME!](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122054/http:/typophile.com/node/56767)  
 [can anyone please tell me the name of this typeface?](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122054/http:/typophile.com/node/56796)  
 [Name of this font??thxx](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122054/http:/typophile.com/node/56920)  
 [Funky 70s Sans Art Nouveau Style](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122054/http:/typophile.com/node/56934)  
 [mystery sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122054/http:/typophile.com/node/56945)  
 [ID: coup logo . Any ideas?](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122054/http:/typophile.com/node/56958)  
 [What is this font????](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122054/http:/typophile.com/node/56973)  
 [Flex-Kleen label](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122054/http:/typophile.com/node/56981)  
 [ID: RANDOM NOTES ?](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122054/http:/typophile.com/node/57041)  
 [Curvy 'e'](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122054/http:/typophile.com/node/57378)  
 [Bauhaus-like font](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122054/http:/typophile.com/node/57453)  
 [Please Help, ID Font.](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122054/http:/typophile.com/node/57481)  
 [Help ID stylized sans-serif font](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122054/http:/typophile.com/node/57504)  
 [Isonorm or DIN alike, very elegant](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122054/http:/typophile.com/node/57527)

// SERIF

[Marvel mystery oil logo font?](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122054/http:/typophile.com/node/57072)  
 [Community South font](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122054/http:/typophile.com/node/57506)  
 [font used on the After Eight yacht](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122054/http:/typophile.com/node/57543)

// SCRIPT

[What is this font?](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122054/http:/typophile.com/node/57047)

// DISPLAY

[Palahniuk's Pygmy Book Cover Font?](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122054/http:/typophile.com/node/57045)

// CYRILLIC

[Two more Soviet newspaper cyrillics: Portable Radiotelephone](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122054/http:/typophile.com/node/56510)
author: Jared Benson

comments.content: I believe I answered the first sans request: _City Guilds_ set in [Congress Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122054/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/clubtype/congress-sans/) with a modified _G_.

Possible answer to the fourth "help identifying font?".

Faricy by Chris Dickinson.
New Wave Films is Dalton Maag's [Interface](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202122054/http:/www.daltonmaag.com/browse/fonts/dama/interface)
